website_summaries.verdict: A simple way to lift heavy objects without needing large harnesses or handle straps.
pros: Simple, straightforward design is extremely versatile for different objects and lifting tasks
Support handle loops are comfortable to hold for short periods of time with a secure grip
cons: Straps are large and awkward when wrapping around larger objects with odd shapes

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy sling - especially for it's price point.
customer_reviews.text: While the product details are a bit misleading (the actual load rating printed on the label gives capacity numbers of 3100 vertical, 2480 choke, and 9400lbs basket style), it's still a heck of a bargain for what it's able to do. I bought it for a choke type application, but it'll come in handy for years to come. At under $20, it's well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Worth having a couple on hand if you move anything
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought one of these as a short tow or tree strap. I then needed to lift a tractor implement and didn't have any chain, so I made it work with this strap and some large D-rings. Bought another just to have more lifting options. Pay attention to the weight ratings- you don't want to try and lift a D5 and then crawl under it like a moron. But for normal stuff, lifting a mower up to scrape the deck or sharpen the blades, these straps are great. Plus you don't have to worry about scratching paint the same way you would with chain.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Nice strap
customer_reviews.text: Good quality great price. I got this for atv winching and its great. I only wish the strap ends would have been folded then stitched together. The are to big for my winch hook so i bought a couple d rings which work out great with the strap and snatch block so im well happy with my diy winching kit .
customer_reviews.author: garland

customer_reviews.title: Can't Do Without
customer_reviews.text: I am a hobby farmer with multiple acres and several trucks/tractors/recreational vehicles. These straps are invaluable in all kinds of lifting, towing, dragging, etc. I buy them 3 at a time and invariably will give them away to freinds and neighbors who need them. With back and shoulder problems (age 72) these straps save me from injury after injury. I cannot so without them. Buy several; youwon't regret it. Cost effective and strong.
customer_reviews.author: Robt G.

customer_reviews.title: Orderd 2, got one new, one used
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these and got one new and one used (dirty and had a run in it where it has obviously had quite a bit of weight on it. I needed them to move a milling machine in a hurry so I did not complain or send one back. Still a poor showing.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E Stora

customer_reviews.title: Great for transferring to or from a wheel chair, bed, chair, or car .
customer_reviews.text: The length and width are just right. The handle loops are big enough to put your hands and wrist through to put the pulling force on your fore arm instead of hand and fingers. I couldn't do without it.
customer_reviews.author: little auggie

customer_reviews.title: Every tow/lift kit needs at least two of these slings..
customer_reviews.text: Every tow/lift kit needs at least two of these keepers available. Long enough to put around bigger objects being lifted, or around tree or post to anchor a winch.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Higdon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: VERY STRONG and VERY GOOD VALUE. I have used these straps to carry countless heavy/bulky items. Also good for tying down on trailer. I use this to lift heavy items by hand, winch or pulley hoist.
customer_reviews.author: mattihs27

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: Used two of these for a tree swing . Used them to attach to the tree branch and protect the tree from being cut by bare rope attachment to the tree. It worked great, no injury to the tree.
customer_reviews.author: G13

customer_reviews.title: Very strong
customer_reviews.text: Good material. Used to suspend a 1-ton chain hoist from a garage beam, the strap neither stretched nor frayed handling a 700-lb. item. Very satisfied buyer.
customer_reviews.author: RCW

customer_reviews.title: I wish the loops were folded over.
customer_reviews.text: Because the loops are not folded over, I had a bit of trouble getting a basket type configuration into the hook on my chain hoist.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strong and great price
customer_reviews.text: For $10 how can anyone complain? On my doorstep in about 3 days. I use it with a 1300 pound electric hoist to lift my heavy Scag mower front to clean under the deck. The strap doesn't even strain, or show signs of wear after repeated use. What else can I say? Maybe order more than one, they come in handy!
customer_reviews.author: Fleur

customer_reviews.title: Quality product!
customer_reviews.text: Product was used in an ongoing classic muscle car restoration project. It met me strict quality criteria!
customer_reviews.author: Parlous1

customer_reviews.title: KEEPER (02612 6' x 2" Lift Sling
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted at reasonable price, strong sturdy strap with 3,100 pounds Vertical lifting capacity..!!
customer_reviews.author: CR

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great for Construction
customer_reviews.text: Used with ourto lift up trusses and rafters to build a house addition
customer_reviews.author: sbhye

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product beating most competitors including Harbour Freight plus its to our farm on time where we don’t drive that’s another bonus. Amazon helps our farm and household work more efficiently. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: WelshRugbyMan

customer_reviews.title: Does its job
customer_reviews.text: Super little choker. Keep it in my Polaris Ranger to wrap trees to winch myself out or to wrap around cages to winch other utv and atv out.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: NOT as Pictured
customer_reviews.text: These slings are NOT as pictured. They have full-width eyes and NOT folded eyes as pictured, to make attachment easier in shackles and other connecting links.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Riversong

customer_reviews.title: I wanted a wide webbing and these are perfect. The 6' length is just about perfect for ...
customer_reviews.text: I use two of these to hoist my kayak in my garage. I wanted a wide webbing and these are perfect. The 6' length is just about perfect for looping around my kayak as well. They feel really strong, though I can't guarantee that this can hold anywhere close to the weight advertised since I'm just using them for a kayak.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: this was used in combination with the Maasdam PowR Pull. I was able to slip one end through the opposite loop and cinch it up on the rocks and thereby pull large rocks out of holes in the ground.
customer_reviews.author: dhr

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: use them as a safety harness for my wife. strong enough, works well for our application.
customer_reviews.author: rodney watson

customer_reviews.title: never had to use it
customer_reviews.text: I have never used this, its for my sxs and I have all hope that it will perform well when I need it
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Just plain old fashioned excellent quality.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome quality, very heavy duty. Use them to lift heavy woodworking equipment with my tractor.
customer_reviews.author: MJRWey

customer_reviews.title: Great for rigging
customer_reviews.text: Totally depended on these straps(bought 2). Rigged 20-30 foot poles for my shop.

customer_reviews.title: Nice straps.
customer_reviews.text: I use these for skidding love onto my trailer, they work great. I abuse them quite a bit and they are starting to fray a little but no broken stitches or wear spots yet.

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: I love it... I have only used it one time lifting a large & loaded tool box from a F-150 truck utilizing a 'shop crane' I bought from Harbor Freight. It worked like a charm. I plan to obtain one more for stability when lifting such a large item.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy A. Jarrell Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Light work only I guess
customer_reviews.text: Works okay but not meant for real work second time using it and it the black mesh is torn and yellow under that is fraying

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Used it for lifting a lathe bed and other machine parts. Worked well.

customer_reviews.title: good for winch anchor point
customer_reviews.text: will work with my utv winch as an anchor point

customer_reviews.title: easy to use and reliable.
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of trying to find a place for the excess length of a longer tow strap and order this. It works well and there is no clutter to get tangled .
customer_reviews.author: Trail Junkie

customer_reviews.title: well made
customer_reviews.text: It's really stiff ; will take some use to soften it up. I see no problem for it too handle the weight it suppose too!
customer_reviews.author: Tony S

customer_reviews.title: It works for the purpose that I intended. However ...
customer_reviews.text: It works for the purpose that I intended. However the loops at the ends are quite thick and difficult to thread through a hole.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Huge value for money! Perfect straps
customer_reviews.text: Used these straps I don’t know how many times during our wall-to-beam project. They were absolutely perfect! Very affordable for their capacity and performance, definitely overkill for the beam but that’s how to stay safe while hoisting 700# of tree over your head!
customer_reviews.author: David Gerrans

customer_reviews.title: Armored truck pull
customer_reviews.text: I used this strap to attempt to pull out a 20,000 lb armored truck from the mud. Instead of pulling out the truck it ripped the bumper off of the pulling armored vehicle. The high grade bolts just sheered off like I used a bold cutter. I am very impressed with this strap and will be buying more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Brown

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend these straps for use with hoists
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and great for lifting items with my hoist. Strong and grips what you are lifting.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald E. Hume

customer_reviews.title: This product is made well - very strong - I ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is made well - very strong - I use it as a tie down for my small portable greenhouse.
customer_reviews.author: Dixie Gainer

customer_reviews.title: Great picking sling
customer_reviews.text: I keep one in each truck for winching, rigging, picking with excavator, etc. Versatile and extremely strong make sure you use it with the appropriate shackle and keep it clean for best performance. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Contractor

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price.  AAA+
customer_reviews.text: Using in my sawmill business. Well made, and suits my purpose.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job I needed it for.
customer_reviews.text: Does what it was intended to be used for. Very strong sling.
customer_reviews.author: Stovepype

customer_reviews.title: Needed to move logs
customer_reviews.text: Needed it to move some logs, work just as well as chains.

customer_reviews.title: Use this sling to lift 385# assemblies of irregular shape ...
customer_reviews.text: Use this sling to lift 385# assemblies of irregular shape. The strap is long enough to wrap around the assemblies and hold them secure during handling. Will come in very handy in our warehouse.

customer_reviews.title: good value

customer_reviews.title: Used for moving furniture to pulling something with your truck.

customer_reviews.title: Great for tree felling
customer_reviews.text: I use a pair of these straps in conjunction with a come along to help direct the fall of trees I cut down on my property. These are way overkill what I need, the winch I use is only 1 ton, but these are just about the right size and fit the bill price-wise. I use one of these as an anchor for my come along, and another to connect to the tree I'm cutting down. These seem well sewn, and I like how the loops are reinforced and stitched. Can't ask for much more.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: 3100lb actual rating
customer_reviews.text: For the price I'm just going to keep it. BUT it is only rated at 3100lb direct lift and 6200lb if doubled up. The description is very misleading and makes you think it's a 20,000lb strap.

customer_reviews.title: ... sling it over the rear axle and have a good, solid attaching point for my two heavy straps ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use as an axle strap when towing cars - I sling it over the rear axle and have a good, solid attaching point for my two heavy straps without marring up paint or cutting my expensive straps. Only downside I've found is the webbing is quite stiff and difficult to fold for storage. I expect it will improve with time.

product_meta.title: KEEPER (02612 6' x 2" Lift Sling
product_meta.description: Keeper Performance Engineered Slings are made from Hi-Test webbing and meet WSTDA standards. These polyester web slings with flat eye to eye loop ends are versatile slings for general use. Use in choker, basket or vertical hitches. Heavy duty fabric covered loop ends are more durable. Tapered eyes are standard on slings over 3" wide. The 2", 1 Ply slings have vertical/choker/basket capacities of 3100lb/2480lb/6200lb and have a Class 7 rating that uses 20,000lb webbing (9,800lb webbing per inch width minimum).
feature_bullets: 1 Ply, 6' x 2" lifting sling with flat loops
Lighter and easier to use than a chain

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars589 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
